title: After NBA, Now Olympic Basketball Qualifiers Will Be Held In India Next Year

After NBA, Now Olympic Basketball Qualifiers Will Be Held In India Next Year

After NBA, Now Olympic Basketball Qualifiers Will Be Held In India Next Year

After the historic date with NBA Games, India will now be hosting the 3x3 basketball qualifiers for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics in March next year.

USA Today

The International Basketball Federation (FIBA) has confirmed the developments and announced that the qualifiers will take place in the country.

The tournament will feature 40 teams (20 in each gender), the location for which will be announced later. Six tickets (three per gender) to next year Olympics will be awarded at the Olympic qualifying tournament, said FIBA in a press release.

Getty Images

It would mean that Indian team will have the home advantage and will have an added motivation to do well, and qualify for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. The games will take place in march with the venues yet to be finalised.

"It is a great honour to host such an important event in India and to see our players give it all on home soil for a berth to the first-ever 3x3 Olympic tournament," said Basketball Federation of India (BFI) President Govindaraj Kempareddy.

"We are delighted to host the Olympic qualifying tournament in India", FIBA Secretary General Andreas Zagklis said.

Facebook/BFI

"Following the successful organisation of two consecutive FIBA Women's Asia Cup in Bangalore by the BFI, we are looking forward to organising now a key 3x3 event in a country where our new Olympic discipline already has a strong fanbase."

In addition to the host teams, the remaining of the 40 participating teams are qualified via the FIBA rankings and the results of the FIBA World Cup held in Amsterdam.

The 3x3 basketball event was only added to the Olympic program in 2017, and the discipline will make its bow in the Japan next year where eight-team tournaments will be held for men and women.

It will be another monumental occasion after the recent NBA games, which proved to be a real hit among fans.

(With Inputs From IANS)
